name: Albemarle Inn

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We have stayed in Asheville several times, but never at a Bed and Breakfast. Albemarle Inn was a wonderful surprise! We loved the home, our room, the food, and especially the guests, employees and owners. We will definitely make this a destination next time so we have time to enjoy all of the amenities.
reviews.title: Next time this will be our destination, not just an overnight visit.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We had a great time and stay at the Ablemarle Inn. Everyone was extremely nice and helpful in assisting us with restaurant recommendations and sites and places to visit in the Asheville area. This was our first trip to Asheville and it was a memorable experience. The breakfasts were plentiful and delicious and it was nice to get together in the early evening for a glass of wine or blueberry homemade tea and some light snacks. We will definitely recommend this B&B to our friends and family. Thanks for making our stay so special!
reviews.title: A lovely gateway - highly recommend staying at the Albemarle Inn!

reviews.text: Barbara and Bill Gablin
reviews.title: Wonderful, wonderful, wonderful

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Besides the beautiful house, the lovely surroundings, and the delicious food, the one thing that makes this B & B a first choice must be the friendly and extremely accommodating owners and staff. The whole atmosphere was pleasant and easy-going, but totally professional at the same time.
reviews.title: Excellent service & fabulous food!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I wouldn't hesitate to recommend this B & B to anyone reading this write-up.
reviews.title: Lovely B&B in a wonderful location; couldn't have made me feel more comfortable
Charming!
reviews.text: We were fortunate to stay at the Albemarle Inn for 2 nights during our recent visit to Asheville, North Carolina. The accommodations were clean and comfortable, staff helpful and food fantastic! It was such a pleasure to meet and get to visit with the owners. Lovely place!! We would highly recommend staying at this lovely historic home to all that visit the area.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I have never stayed in such an awesome place. Kathy and the girls are the most kind, helpful, sweet people I have ever met. We have never enjoyed ourselves so much. The Victorian rooms are quite a plus as I always pictured myself as a “New York Scarlett O’Hara”. Thank you all so much for a great time. The food was quite gourmet. There aren't enough wonderful words to describe this inn. I give this the highest rating I could and it still doesn't do it justice. HIGHLY RECOMMEND Thanks again.”
reviews.title: cozy, warm victorian inn

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The inn was everything you would expect of a quality establishment. The Hostess that met us at the door upon arriving settled us in our Oak room and gave us a quick tour of the Inn. What a relaxing weekend with the beautiful gardens that surround the inn, the great breakfast each morning and wine in the evening. Larry and Cathy the owners made us feel special. Thanks for pampering us. Peg and Gage
reviews.title: The Perfect Anniversary

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The Albemarle Inn is an incredible place. Beautifully restored historic home with 11 unique and artfully decorated rooms. Ridiculously good gourmet breakfast in the morning, served by friendly staff in relaxing yet elegant setting. Well-staffed, willing and able to help with retaurants, sight-seeing/concierge-type service. Highly recommended for a wonderful time in Asheville!
reviews.title: A fantastic bed and breakfast in a wonderful town!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: When my husband made our reservation he spoke with Sabrina. To our surprise Sabrina was the one who greeted us. From the start it was an outstanding experience. This was a birthday gift from my husband and I was never disappointed! Our room was beautiful, it was called "The Old Oak." Sabrina explained all the workings of the Inn, when breakfast was served, and how we could make coffee earlier if we wanted. She also mentioned that at 5 p.m. they served wine, beverages and hors d' oeuvres, and hoped we would join the other guests. My husband asked about some dinner choices and she gave us excellent suggestions. The next morning we were served a 3 course Gourmet Breakfast!! The food was fantastic! We had 3 of these lovely Gourmet Breakfast's and everyone was wonderful. I even asked for a couple of the recipes and Jennifer was more than glad to get them. On our way home 3 days later we looked at each other and said this was most definitely a place we will come back to. We were sorry we hadn't booked 5 nights. The Albemarle Inn is just beautiful and an absolute "Treasure." Thanks to Kathy, Larry and their wonderful staff for making my birthday one to remember. Make sure you book early if you want to see the fall colors, the Inn was full when we left.
reviews.title: The Albemarle Inn is a "Treasure."

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We very much enjoyed our short stay at the Albermarle Inn in Asheville.
reviews.title: Lovely Inn, Welcoming Hosts

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The house is very impressive, and conveniently located within a few miles of downtown Asheville. The hosts were welcoming, even gave us glasses of wine to sip on the porch after our late arrival.
reviews.title: Romantic and Charming

reviews.text: The room was very comfortable and charming, loved the bath robes, fireplace, and private bathroom with stand-alone tub and refined toiletries. Only down-side: our room was on the first floor, so it was a little loud when we tried to nap (needed some rest before going out at night!), and in the morning due to the breakfast activity. I would get a room upstairs for a future visit.
reviews.title: Girl's Getaway to the Biltmore Estate

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Breakfast was delicious, fresh fruit and stuffed croissant, served at your private table. I would have liked breakfast to be served a little later (personally 8:30-9:00am is too early for me on a vacation day), but I can understand the hosts cannot serve breakfast all morning. Note that guests can request a later continental breakfast, so it's no major issue.
reviews.title: What a find!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Overall a great stay at the Abemarlee Inn, I strongly recommend staying there if you are planning a romantic getaway!
reviews.title: Biltmore elegance in a friendly, warm atmosphere.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: This B&B is second to none! We have stayed at many B&B's here and abroad over the years, and this one surpasses all the others in each and every catagory. The owners, Cathy and Larry have perfected the B&B experience. The property seems to have sprung to life from the pages of Southern Living. The spacious Inn is beautifully and elegantly appointed. The staff is friendly and accomodating and the food is simply spectacular. Albemarle is close enough to be convenient to everything but also tucked away enough to be a truly relaxing retreat. Asheville is a wonderful getaway; a sophisticated city with the charm and hospitality of a small town and the Albemarle Inn reflects all of the best Asheville has to offer.
reviews.title: Best B&B experience ever!!!

description: This AAA 4-Diamond romantic period mansion offers elegant guest rooms with pampering down duvets and fine linens, antique soaking tubs (or 2-person whirlpool) with fragrant bath products. Enjoy an award-winning breakfast at private tables on the sunporch and afternoon refreshments on the veranda or by the fire. Minutes to Biltmore, downtown restaurants and shops and The Blue Ridge Parkway.
